Show:

GridTopology Class

Extends MeshTopology
Defined in: src/davinci-eight/topologies/GridTopology.ts:87
Module: EIGHT

Constructs a grid that is open on all sides and rendered using TRIANGLE_STRIP.

The grid orientation is such that when the first dimension is aligned to east, and the second dimension is aligned to north, the orientation is positive (counterclockwise) when viewed from above.

Constructor

GridTopology

(
  • segmentCounts
)

Defined in src/davinci-eight/topologies/GridTopology.ts:87

Parameters:

  • segmentCounts Number[]

    The number of segments for each dimension.

Example:

    // Create a new topology with 5 segments in the first dimension, and 3 segments in the second dimension.
    var topo = new EIGHT.GridTopology([5, 3]);
    // Set attributes on each vertex ...
    // Compute the elements required for drawing
    var elements: EIGHT.GeometryElements = topo.toElements()
  • Index
  • Methods
  • Properties

Methods

toElements

() GeometryElements

Inherited from Topology: src/davinci-eight/topologies/Topology.ts:70

Creates the elements in a format required for WebGL. This may involve creating some redundancy in order to get WebGL efficiency. Thus, we should regard the topology as normalized

Returns:

GeometryElements:

vertex

(
  • coordinates
)
Vertex

Defined in src/davinci-eight/topologies/GridTopology.ts:111

Provides access to each vertex so that attributes may be set.

Parameters:

  • coordinates Number[]

    The integral coordinates of the vertex required.

Returns:

Vertex:

The vertex corresponding to the specified coordinates.

Example:

    var topo = new EIGHT.GridTopology([1, 1])
    topo.vertex([i, j]).attributes('aPosition') = new Vector3([i - 0.5, j - 0.5, 0])

Properties

dimensions

Number[]

Defined in src/davinci-eight/topologies/GridTopology.ts:79

The number of points for each dimension (dimensionsi = segmentCountsi + 1).
